quote: Character sketches for possible    stories...
A Bolian tries to impress a dabo    girl... by wearing a toupee...
A thief disguises himself as a   Monk so he can swindle a   Ferengi...
A woman... traveling alone...    she's come a long way...
Good morning...
Punctual, as always...
Don't even start.
What are you looking at?
So I'm a few minutes late. I was   here till four in the morning last   night.
You close at two.
You never know what time your last    customer is going to leave.        Right, Morn?
If this were my bar, I'd have it    cleared out promptly at two A.M.
If this were your bar, people    would be so bored you'd be lucky    to get them to stay past nine.
But I wouldn't keep them waiting    in the morning...
Ambassador Troi...
Please... Lwaxana...
I'm sorry... if that's what you    prefer.
Is there something wrong... why    are you crying?
Because...
I'm pregnant...
It's a miracle. I never thought    I'd be able to have another baby.
Then those are tears of    happiness...
I won't let him do it, Odo!
Who... what?
My husband -- Jeyal -- he wants to   take my baby from me! That's why    I ran away!
Lwaxana, please. Try to be calm.    Now, why would your husband want    to take your baby from you?
He's Tavnian.
And?
They believe in strict separation    of the sexes. Boys are raised by    men, girls by women. Those poor    children aren't even told the    other sex exists until they're    sixteen.
And your child is male.

The day Jeyal found out, he said    he was going to take the baby away    from me as soon as he was born    I told him that wasn't what we'd    agreed to; he'd said it would be    different with us because I wasn't    Tavnian.
But he changed his mind.
During our wedding ceremony, he    spoke so beautifully about why he    wanted to marry me, but afterwards    it was as if I'd become a piece of    property in his eyes.
So you ran away.
And it wasn't easy, believe me.    Toward the end, I was practically    a prisoner in my own house.
Now that you've shown your husband    how determined you are to be part    of your son's life, perhaps he'll    reconsider his position.
Not Jeyal. He's the most willful    man I've ever met.
I'm so tired, Odo. I've never    needed a friend more than I do    right now.
I appreciate your situation, and   I would like to help...
I knew you would. You're such a    sweet, dear man.
Unfortunately, I'm also a very busy man.
Of course. Believe me, the last    thing I want is to be a burden to    you. I know how much you value    your privacy. All I want is a    quiet place where I can have my    baby in peace.
I was about to suggest the very    thing. I'll find out when the    next transport leaves for Betazed.
I couldn't possibly go there.    That's the first place Jeyal will    look for me. I know him. He    won't give up until he finds me    and gets his son back.
That's why I came to you. Because    I knew you'd protect me.
You will protect me, won't you,    Odo?
I'm chief of security on this    station. It's my duty to protect    everyone aboard.
I knew I could count on you.       Then it's settled, I'll have the    baby here.
I'll see that you're assigned    quarters.
Near yours? I really would feel    safer knowing you're close.
I'll see what I can do.
Thank you, Odo. You don't know    what this means to me.
No... but I know what it means    to me...
You're a writer...
I could see it in your eyes...    they were somewhere else. A place    you were... inventing.
I'm working on a story...
I can spot a creative soul a    galaxy away.
My name is Onaya.
Jake Sisko.
Do you live here?
I love Cardassian architecture...    the way things flow together.    Kell used to say that every    element had to be "of a piece, yet    have a beauty all it's own."
Tavor Kell -- the architect?
I knew him when he was in exile.
What was he like?
He was shy... unsure of himself.    Most people would never notice    someone like him, but I have a    weakness for artists.
You wouldn't think he was shy from    his designs.
When I first met him, they were as    timid as he was. I was always    telling him to stop censoring    himself.
He must've listened to you.
I've found that artists have a    weakness for me, as well...
At least... I hope they do...
I... I've always wondered what    Kell would've designed if he'd    lived to be older.
He accomplished more in the years    that he had than most people could    in a dozen lifetimes. His name is    known throughout the quadrant...    his buildings will stand for    centuries to come.
Isn't that what an artist wants,    to be remembered? Isn't that why    you write?
I don't know... I think it's    mostly because I like to tell    stories.
There's no reason to hide your    ambition, Jake. It's nothing to    be ashamed of. I think it's what    makes artists so compelling.
All right... I guess I do want to    be remembered.
So what are you doing to make sure    you will be... ?
Well... I'm thinking about going    to the Pennington School, on    Earth.
You already have the talent inside    you. I can see it. You just need    someone to help you bring it to    the surface.
How?
There are ways. Exercises...    techniques.
Can you show them to me?
Come to my quarters tonight.
I'll be there.
Are you packed? Kasidy's ship is    going to be here any minute.
Dad... I'm thinking about staying    home.
Staying home? This trip was your    idea.
I know...
You really want to pass up three    days in the Bajoran outback?
I thought maybe you and Kasidy    would have a better time without    me.
You can lay off the matchmaking    Jake, Kasidy and I are doing fine.
It's not just that... I've got a    story I'm working on and I don't    want to lose my concentration.
You could write on the trip.       I'm not trying to talk you into    anything, but I don't get leave    that often, and I was looking    forward to the three of us    spending time together.
Me, too... but I really need to    focus on this.
All right... good luck with it.
I'll see you in a couple days.
You called me out of a security    briefing... this better be    important.
It is to me.
... that's when I realized what a    terrible mistake I'd made -- that    my marriage was a sham... what I'd    mistaken for love was nothing more    than a prison.
I shouldn't dwell on it... it's    all in the past anyway...
So... where are you ladies off to?
A holosuite...
King Arthur's Court...
Camelot... love betrayed... dreams    shattered...       I'm coming with you.
Look at them, you'd think somebody    died. I don't know if it's    because she's Betazoid or what,    but her mood's contagious. As    soon as she walked in here, things    started getting quiet.
What do you want me to do about    it?
Either cheer her up, or get her to    leave. Because if you don't, I'm    going to throw her out.
Odo... why don't you join the    party?
Actually, I have some free time...    and I was wondering if you wanted    to take a walk.
I would.
I meant Lwaxana.
I'd love to.       Sorry... maybe next time.
I'm so depressed.
Ladies, your holosuite is ready...       Yours will be another few minutes.
I don't know... I don't really    feel like it anymore.
Me neither.
What about you? A nice battle    ought to cheer you up.
I am not in the mood for killing    right now...
Fine, you all know my policy on    cancellations...
No refunds...
Kestra was six years old when she    died. My sweet little girl.       I lost my parents, a sister, a    husband... but nothing, nothing    compared to losing her.
I didn't mean to go on like that.    I'm sorry.
Don't apologize. I think I    finally understand why you're so    determined not to let your husband    take the baby from you...
These are your quarters, aren't    they?
Right next to yours.
My replicator is acting up. Would    you mind terribly if we popped in    so I could get a cup of Gavaline    tea?
Of course not...
The replicator is right over here.    I'll let Chief O'Brien know about    yours.
I already did. He said he'd get    to it as soon as he could.
Gavaline tea...
Hot.
Is this for shape-shifting... ?
Yes, actually. Most people think   it's a sculpture.
Well, what do most people know?
Thank you...
May I ask you something, Odo?       Are you over her?
Don't worry, I'm not going to   throw myself at you if you say   yes.
Major Kira is involved with First   Minister Shakaar now.
How sad...
Not at all. I'm happy for her.
Just don't go do what I did.       Look for someone to fix your    broken heart... then end up    pregnant and on the run.
I don't think there's too much    danger of that happening.
Oh...
What is it?
The baby kicked... can I sit down    for a minute?
I don't have any furniture.
The floor will do...
How are you feeling now?
Like a changeling who's had to   hold his shape too long...
I think I know what you mean...
He's moving...
Would you like to feel?
There!
Yes...
I'm so tired... I don't think I've    had a decent night's sleep in    weeks...
Sometimes, with Betazoid babies,    you can actually sense their    thoughts...
Such... contentment...
Yes... I feel it, too...
Someone once said that life is a    search to find the peace we once    had when we were safe inside our    mothers...
I... didn't have a mother...
Don't worry, Odo... you'll find    your peace, just the same...
Lwaxana... your replicator's not    really broken, is it?
No...
I'm sorry if I made you feel    unwelcome... it's just my way...
Lwaxana... ?
It's Jake... Jake Sisko. Remember    me?
Come in...
I brought some of my stories for    you to read...
I don't need to.
Oh... I thought maybe --
It's what you're going to write    next that interests me.       You seem nervous, Jake.
Maybe a little.
That's understandable. You should    be nervous when you start    something new.
Though maybe not this nervous.    Haven't you ever been alone in a    woman's quarters before?
Whatever you're thinking, put it    out of your mind -- you're here to    work.
Now, what's the most ambitious    story you've ever wanted to tell?
I have an idea for a novel. It's    sort of autobiographical. The    main character's mother dies    and... it's not really about    that... it's about a lot of    things...
So many it seems too big for you,    right now. You're afraid you    can't do it justice.
Yeah...
But I'll bet you know what the   first line is.
How'd you know that?
I want to show you something.
Revalus used it when he wrote "The   Wait."
You knew him?
I told you I have a weakness for   artists...       I want you to have it...
I don't know what to say... Thank   you.
There's more...
I've never worked on paper before.
Revalus used to say a writer    should put pen to paper as if he   were a painter putting brush to    canvas. It's part of what he    called "visceral writing."
What's that?
It's one of the techniques I told    you about.
Can you teach it to me?
That's why you're here, isn't it?
The opening line of your novel...    write it down.
Now...       Keep going.
What do you mean, keep going?
Write whatever comes to you... the    idea is to create a stream of    consciousness and see where it    takes you. You can edit later.
Just write the first thing that    comes to mind... I won't look...
Let the words tumble out of you...    don't censor them...
Feel the pen in your hand... the    texture of the paper... let    yourself fall into a rhythm...
Feel where my thumb is... ? That's    your foramen magnum... it's a focal    point of the body's bioelectric    field... there's another    one here...
The Vulcans call them qui'lari...    the Indians of ancient Earth    called them shakras...
I know how to stimulate them to    make you feel restful... or    energized... or even creative...
This isn't bad...
I told you I could help you.
Let the words flow, Jake... let    them flow...
Yes... that's it... let them    flow...
There you are!
Got you that time.
That's not fair. I didn't know   you could do surfaces.
Now you do.
(playfully rising to the     challenge)   Shall we try again?
Sure you're up to it?
Absolutely, I haven't had this    much fun in months.
Really?       Neither have I.
Security to Odo.
Go ahead.
A transport just arrived from the    Umani sector... the man you asked    us to look out for was on it.
Acknowledged. You know what to    do.
It's my husband isn't it?
Stay here. I'll handle this.
You'd better have a good reason    for dragging me in here.
I'm chief of station security.    That's all the reason I need.
Well, well...
You're the changeling. Odo... if    I remember correctly.
What of it?
Lwaxana told me all about you...    how you broke her heart.
Strange she'd come running to you    for protection. The pregnancy    must have her confused, poor    woman.
I find her remarkably clear-   headed. She doesn't want to see    you; you might as well turn around    and go home.
I've come a long way, I'm not    going to leave emptyhanded.
She's not going back with you.
I'm not talking about her.
I'm talking about my son. I    intend to see he's raised by men    away from the pampering    foolishness of women.
I hate to disappoint you, but    Lwaxana has no intention of giving    him up to you.
Her intentions don't concern me.    As her husband, I have a legal    right to my son.
I've been familiarizing myself    with Tavnian law. It's well    established that a male child is    considered the property of the    mother's husband.
Exactly.
Not the child's father... the    mother's husband... by the time    Lwaxana gives birth, you won't be    her husband. I will.
We're getting married?
If you take me as your husband in    a legal Tavnian ceremony, your    marriage to Jeyal will be    automatically annulled and he'll    lose his claim to the baby.
I don't quite know what to say.       I'm just so touched that you're    willing to do this for me...

It's not so much, really. We'll    remain husband and wife for a few    months, long enough to satisfy    Tavnian law, and then get an    annulment of our own.        It isn't as if I was planning to    marry someone else.
Even so... thank you.
There is one thing I don't    understand. Jeyal insisted on    staying and witnessing the    ceremony.
He did?
Is that a problem?

In a Tavnian wedding, the groom    has to stand before the bride and    tell her why he wants to marry    her. In front of his family and    friends, he must proclaim his love    for her and convince her to accept    him as her husband.
I trust I can count on you to    accept me -- even if I just stand    there and read last week's    Criminal Activity Report.
You don't understand, if anyone    present doubts the groom's    sincerity, they can challenge the    validity of the marriage.
You mean... I have to convince    Jeyal I want to marry you?
without stopping)   I've never been able to write like    this... the ideas are coming so    fast... I can barely keep up with    them.
It's amazing, isn't it... ?
Jake...
It's okay... it's just a    nosebleed.
You should rest.
I'll be all right. It's already    stopped.
Where was I...
Did I miss something? I didn't   know Odo was getting married until   this morning.
I'm not sure he knew either...
Who's that?
I think he's Lwaxana's husband.
Nice of him to come.
I don't believe it. How could Odo    do this to me? It's so unfair.
Is there something going on    between you and Odo I don't know    about?
Don't be ridiculous. All I'm    saying is that I could've arranged    a beautiful reception if he'd    given me enough notice.
And enough latinum.
If he thinks he's getting a    wedding gift from me, he's got    another thing coming...
I'm so glad you could make it.
I'm sure you are. It's not too    late to call it off.       Your dignity is important to you.    I understand that. I wouldn't    want anyone to see me go through    a charade like this.
If you don't mind... this is a    very special moment for me...
In keeping with Tavnian tradition,    I stand before you -- here in my    home, among my worldly possessions --    in order to declare my wish to add    this woman to that which is mine...
She is as kind as she is    beautiful... and I want her to be    part of my life from this day on.
Marry me, Lwaxana...
Am I the only one here who finds    this little more than a pale    declaration of love?
He could be talking about any    woman.
Lwaxana isn't just any woman.
Not to me.
Before I met her, my world was a   much smaller place. I kept to    myself. I didn't need anyone    else... and I took pride in that.
The truth is... I was ashamed of    what I was... afraid that if    people saw how truly different I    was... they would recoil from me.
Lwaxana saw how different I was...    but she didn't recoil. She wanted    to see more.
For the first time in my life,    someone wanted me as I was. And    that changed me... forever.
The day I met her, is the day    I stopped being alone.
And I want her to be part of my    life from this day on.
Marry me, Lwaxana... let me into    your light...
Lwaxana... ?
I give myself to you... forever    and always.
I say for all to hear... that this    woman is mine. If anyone    challenges my claim to her,    let them do so now...
I present to you... my beloved    wife...
I cherished you, Lwaxana... you    were my most treasured possession.
Take care of our son. When he    asks, speak well of me...
Ladies and Gentlemen... please do   me the honor of accompanying me to    my humble establishment. I'm    throwing a party for the happy    couple!
What can I say? I'm a hopeless    romantic.
Are you all right?
We did it. He's really leaving.
It would appear so.
You were wonderful, Odo. For a    minute there, even I believed you    wanted to marry me.
I suppose we should tell them the    truth...       But let's wait till after the    party.
Jake...
You should rest...
Not now. I'm onto something.
Your father will be home soon...    you should be there.
I'll see him later.
That's enough.
What'd you do that for?
You're pushing yourself too hard.
No, I'm not. My mind has never    been so clear. Everything's    coming together. At the rate I'm    going, I could have this book    finished in a few days.
And you will. I promise you. But    if you rest now, your work will be    even better.
All right... I'll go home. Maybe    get some sleep.
You'll come back later?
Of course.       I need you.
Orange juice.

Something has stimulated Jake's    brain functioning in a way I've    never seen. The capillaries in    his cerebral cortex have dilated    twenty percent, neurotransmitter    production is up by at least that    amount, and neural activity is off    the scale.
Do you have any idea what caused    it?
Not yet... but it's a good thing    we got him in here when we did.    His cortex was on the verge of    synaptic collapse.
But he's going to be all right?
I need to keep him in a neural    stabilization field for a while.
Onaya...
Jake...
Where is she, dad... ?
Jake. Tell me what happened.
I'm going to go talk to Odo, see    if he knows anything about this...    Onaya.
We'll let you know if his   condition changes.
I'll be in the lab.
Come with me, Jake... it's time to    finish what we've started...
I'm picking up traces of some sort    of... psionic energy.       It's concentrated here, where    Nurse Tagana said she saw    something come through the    bulkhead.
Captain, the tests I ran indicated    that Jake's mental activity was    stimulated by some kind of psionic    phenomenon -- possibly telepathic    in nature.
Then this entity Nurse Tagana saw    could've been responsible.
We have to find it -- and get Jake    back in a neural stabilization    field before it's too late.
I'll tell Odo to have his search    parties reconfigure their    tricorders to scan for psionic    energy.
That'll help, but only for a    while... psionic residue decays    within minutes.
Then we'd better get moving...
Keep going, Jake...

The moment I saw you, I knew that    you were worthy of what I could    give you... but I can't stay with you   forever... this is your chance    to create something that will live    on, long after you're gone...
There... it'll stop in a minute...
I'm getting something... about   twenty meters in this direction...
(gesturing down the     tunnel)   I'll go this way... you swing   around and take Tunnel Sixty-one   G...
(gently   What's wrong?
I can't...
Let me help you...
That's better, isn't it... ?
Get away from him...
Dad... don't interfere...
I said get away.
Sisko to Ops.
Go ahead.
Lock on to my signal and stand by    to beam Jake directly to the    Infirmary.
You're too close to the reactor    core -- there's so much    interference I can't get a lock.
Get a medical team down here right    away.
What are you?
It's not what I am that matters,    it's what I do. You don't know    the minds I've touched: Catullus,    Tarbolde, Keats -- a hundred    others. I unlocked their    potential.
Is that what you did to Jake?       Look at him.
They all died in the end... but    look what I gave them in return:    immortality.       Their names will live forever    because of me.
And you -- what do you get out of    it... ?
What I need to survive -- so I can    go on... find others... and unlock    their talents as well.
He was the youngest I ever    found... so eager... ready to    give everything he had in one    great burst... what a waste...       Good-bye, Jake...
You're not going anywhere.
I have wonderful news. There's a    transport for Betazed leaving this    afternoon.
I'm going home.
But... I thought you were planning    to have the baby here.
If I did, I'd end up staying for    months. And that wouldn't be    fair. I've imposed on you enough.
Lwaxana...       You could deliver at any time now,    and it's a long way to Betazed.       You really should stay.
I'll miss you, too.
Then why leave?
You've gotten used to having me    around, haven't you? You dear,    sweet man. But don't you see,    what you want is company, someone    to take care of.
Is that so wrong?

No, of course not. The problem    is... I want much more than that    from you. I can't help it. I'm    still in love with you. And as    much as I wish you were in love    with me, I know you're not.

I could stay, try to make you fall    in love with me... but we both    know that's not going to happen.    I'd end up resenting you... and    your friendship is too important    for me to let that happen.
That's why it's better for both of   us if I leave now...
Good bye... husband...
Good bye... wife...
How you feeling?
Okay, I guess...       You've read it.
Just finished.
What'd you think?

You've got a good start on a novel    here, Jake.       Your spelling's still terrible,    but the dialogue is sharp, the    story's involving, the characters    are real...       I especially liked the father.
Remind you of anyone?
A bit.       It's really good.
I know. I just wish I wrote it.
You did.
How can I be sure? I mean...    without Onaya...
Listen to me. You wrote these    words, not her.
But she got them out of me.
And that means they were somewhere    inside you.
All you have to do is learn to    find them for yourself.
You're right... But I've got to    tell you, I don't feel up to    writing just yet.
That's understandable. Take it    easy for a while. You'll get back    to it. And someday, when you're    ready, maybe you'll even finish    this.
I hope so.
I gotta get to work.
I'll check in on you in a couple hours.
I'll be here.
